# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:

* Short name: `living_status`
* Variable label: `Living status`
* Variable description: `The individual is dead or alive?`
* Domain: `Death`
* Value type: `categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | alive
1        | Dead
2        | Dropout  

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing

```{r lab, echo=FALSE}
ds_label <- "Living status"
ds_label_all <- "The individual is dead or alive?"
```

# Data process

## Cuba

### Wave 1

```{r assign_cuba1, echo=FALSE}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_id_w1','10-66.1066-Cuba-Baseline',
                         variables=list('centreid'), missings = TRUE)
t1066_id_w1 <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_id_w1')
```


### Harmonisation algorithm
It's considered that at baseline all the individuals are alive. Therefore it is going to compute the variable with all the values as 0. 

**R script:**

```{r harmo_cuba1}
t1066_ds_cuba_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_id_w1$id)
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$living_status <- 0
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$living_status <- labelled(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$living_status, labels = c("Alive"=0, "Dead"=1, "Dropout"=2, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

### Statistics of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript_cuba1, echo=FALSE}
vari <- t1066_ds_cuba_w1$living_status
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3], caption = ds_label) 
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w1, aes(x=factor(living_status))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")
```

```{r importOPAL_cuba1, echo=FALSE}
label(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$living_status) <- ds_label
living_status <- t1066_ds_cuba_w1
save(living_status, file = "../RData/cuba_w1/living_status.RData")
rm(living_status, t1066_id_w1, t1066_id_w2, t1066_ddeath2, t1066_ddeath)
```


### Wave 2

#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `dead`|
|-|-|
| **Label** | `dead by follow-up?`|
| **Table name** | `pyears_(mortality_cohort)_2_0` |
| **Categories** |`0 = alive at follow-up - reinterviewed or refused` |
| | `1 = dead` |
| **Description** |  |


```{r assign_cuba2, echo=FALSE}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_id_w1','10-66.1066-Cuba-Baseline',
                         variables=list('centreid'), missings = TRUE)
t1066_id_w1 <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_id_w1')

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_id_w2','10-66.1066-Cuba-Followup',
                         variables=list('centreid'), missings = TRUE)
t1066_id_w2 <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_id_w2')

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_death2','10-66.pyears_(mortality_cohort)_2_0',
                         variables=list('death_date','dead'), missings = TRUE)
t1066_death2 <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_death2')
t1066_death2$ydeath <- format(t1066_death2$death_date, '%Y')

t1066_death2 <- t1066_death2[c("id", "ydeath", "dead")]


same_indiv <- function(old, new){
  
  new_2 <- matrix(NA, nrow = dim(new)[1], ncol=dim(old)[2])
  oldm <- as.matrix(old)
  
  for(i in 1:length(new$id)){
    if(sum(new$id[i]==old$id)>=1){
      new_2[i,] <- oldm[which(new$id[i]==old$id),]
    } else {
      new_2[i,] <- c(new$id[i], NA, NA)
    }
  }
  
  new_22 <- data.frame(id=new_2[,1], ydeath=as.numeric(new_2[,2]), dead=as.numeric(new_2[,3]))
  new_22
}

t1066_death <- same_indiv(old = t1066_death2, new = t1066_id_w1)
```

```{r local_cuba2, echo=FALSE}
vari <- t1066_death$dead
kable(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[3], caption = ds_label) 
pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(t1066_death, aes(x=factor(vari))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute the harmonized variable it have to recode: 

* `the individuals include in wave 2 dataset as 0 ('alive') `
* `the individuals with a value 1 in dead variable into 1 ('death') `
* `the individuals don't include in wave 2 and with 1 or missing in dead varibale into 2 ('dropout')` 

**R script:**

```{r harmo_cuba2, echo=TRUE}
t1066_ds_cuba_w2 <- tibble(id=t1066_death$id)
t1066_ds_cuba_w2$living_status <- 2
t1066_ds_cuba_w2$living_status[t1066_death$id %in% t1066_id_w2$id] <- 0
t1066_ds_cuba_w2$living_status[which(t1066_death$dead==1)] <- 1
t1066_ds_cuba_w2$living_status <- labelled(t1066_ds_cuba_w2$living_status, labels = c("Alive"=0, "Dead"=1, "Dropout"=2, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

#### Statistical description of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript_cuba2, echo=FALSE}
vari <- t1066_ds_cuba_w2$living_status
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3], caption = ds_label) 
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w2, aes(x=factor(living_status))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Validation
There is a individual that we have date of death and it is posterior to follow up interview:
```{r crosstabulation_cuba2, echo=FALSE}
dd <- t1066_death[which(t1066_death$dead==1),]
ddd <- t1066_death[!is.na(t1066_death$ydeath),]
kable(ddd[!(ddd$id %in% dd$id),])
```


```{r importOPAL_cuba_w2, echo=FALSE}
label(t1066_ds_cuba_w2$living_status) <- ds_label
living_status <- t1066_ds_cuba_w2
save(living_status, file = "../RData/cuba_w2/living_status.RData")
rm(living_status, t1066_id_w1, t1066_id_w2, t1066_death2, t1066_death)
```

| | `1 = dead` |

```{r assign_RCh2, echo=FALSE} 
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_id_w1','10-66.1066-RuralChina-Baseline',
                         variables=list('centreid'), missings = TRUE)
t1066_id_w1 <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_id_w1')

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_id_w2','10-66.1066-RuralChina-Followup',
                         variables=list('centreid'), missings = TRUE)
t1066_id_w2 <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_id_w2')

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_death2','10-66.pyears_(mortality_cohort)_2_0',
                         variables=list('death_date','dead'), missings = TRUE)

same_indiv <- function(old, new){
  
  new_2 <- matrix(NA, nrow = dim(new)[1], ncol=dim(old)[2])
  oldm <- as.matrix(old)
  
  for(i in 1:length(new$id)){
    if(sum(new$id[i]==old$id)>=1){
      new_2[i,] <- oldm[which(new$id[i]==old$id),]
    } else {
      new_2[i,] <- c(new$id[i], NA, NA)
    }
  }
  
  new_22 <- data.frame(id=new_2[,1], ydeath=as.numeric(new_2[,2]), dead=as.numeric(new_2[,3]))
  new_22
}
```

### Wave 2

#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `dead`|
|-|-|
| **Label** | `dead by follow-up?`|
| **Table name** | `pyears_(mortality_cohort)_2_0` |
| **Categories** |`0 = alive at follow-up - reinterviewed or refused` |
| | `1 = dead` |
| **Description** |  |

```{r assign_RP2, echo=FALSE} 
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_id_w1','10-66.1066-RuralPeru-Baseline',
                         variables=list('centreid'), missings = TRUE)
t1066_id_w1 <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_id_w1')

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_id_w2','10-66.1066-RuralPeru-Followup',
                         variables=list('centreid'), missings = TRUE)
t1066_id_w2 <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_id_w2')

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_death2','10-66.pyears_(mortality_cohort)_2_0',
                         variables=list('death_date','dead'), missings = TRUE)
t1066_death2 <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_death2')
t1066_death2$ydeath <- format(t1066_death2$death_date, '%Y')

t1066_death2 <- t1066_death2[c("id", "ydeath", "dead")]


same_indiv <- function(old, new){
  
  new_2 <- matrix(NA, nrow = dim(new)[1], ncol=dim(old)[2])
  oldm <- as.matrix(old)
  
  for(i in 1:length(new$id)){
    if(sum(new$id[i]==old$id)>=1){
      new_2[i,] <- oldm[which(new$id[i]==old$id),]
    } else {
      new_2[i,] <- c(new$id[i], NA, NA)
    }
  }
  
  new_22 <- data.frame(id=new_2[,1], ydeath=as.numeric(new_2[,2]), dead=as.numeric(new_2[,3]))
  new_22
}

t1066_death <- same_indiv(old = t1066_death2, new = t1066_id_w1)
```

```{r local_RP2, echo=FALSE} 
vari <- t1066_death$dead
kable(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[3], caption = ds_label) 
pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(t1066_death, aes(x=factor(vari))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
To compute the harmonized variable it have to recode: 

* `the individuals include in wave 2 dataset as 0 ('alive') `
* `the individuals with a value 1 in dead variable into 1 ('death') `
* `the individuals don't include in wave 2 and with 1 or missing in dead varibale into 2 ('dropout')`

**R script:**

```{r harmo_RP2, echo=TRUE}

t1066_ds_RP_w2$living_status[which(t1066_death$dead==1)] <- 1
t1066_ds_RP_w2$living_status <- labelled(t1066_ds_RP_w2$living_status, labels = c("Alive"=0, "Dead"=1, "Dropout"=2, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

### Wave 2

#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `dead`|
|-|-|
| **Label** | `dead by follow-up?`|
| **Table name** | `pyears_(mortality_cohort)_2_0` |
| **Categories** |`0 = alive at follow-up - reinterviewed or refused` |
| | `1 = dead` |
| **Description** |  |

```{r assign_PR2, echo=FALSE} 
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_id_w1','10-66.1066-PuertoRico-Baseline',
                         variables=list('centreid'), missings = TRUE)
t1066_id_w1 <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_id_w1')

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_id_w2','10-66.1066-PuertoRico-Followup',
                         variables=list('centreid'), missings = TRUE)
t1066_id_w2 <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_id_w2')

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_death2','10-66.pyears_(mortality_cohort)_2_0',
                         variables=list('death_date','dead'), missings = TRUE)
t1066_death2 <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_death2')
t1066_death2$ydeath <- format(t1066_death2$death_date, '%Y')

t1066_death2 <- t1066_death2[c("id", "ydeath", "dead")]


same_indiv <- function(old, new){
  
  new_2 <- matrix(NA, nrow = dim(new)[1], ncol=dim(old)[2])
  oldm <- as.matrix(old)
  
  for(i in 1:length(new$id)){
    if(sum(new$id[i]==old$id)>=1){
      new_2[i,] <- oldm[which(new$id[i]==old$id),]
    } else {
      new_2[i,] <- c(new$id[i], NA, NA)
    }
  }
  
  new_22 <- data.frame(id=new_2[,1], ydeath=as.numeric(new_2[,2]), dead=as.numeric(new_2[,3]))
  new_22
}

t1066_death <- same_indiv(old = t1066_death2, new = t1066_id_w1)
```


#### Harmonisation algorithm
To compute the harmonized variable it have to recode: 

* `the individuals include in wave 2 dataset as 0 ('alive') `
* `the individuals with a value 1 in dead variable into 1 ('death') `
* `the individuals don't include in wave 2 and with 1 or missing in dead varibale into 2 ('dropout')`

**R script:**

```{r harmo_PR2, echo=TRUE} 
t1066_ds_PR_w2 <- tibble(id=t1066_death$id)
t1066_ds_PR_w2$living_status <- 2
t1066_ds_PR_w2$living_status[t1066_death$id %in% t1066_id_w2$id] <- 0
t1066_ds_PR_w2$living_status[which(t1066_death$dead==1)] <- 1
t1066_ds_PR_w2$living_status <- labelled(t1066_ds_PR_w2$living_status, labels = c("Alive"=0, "Dead"=1, "Dropout"=2, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```
